newsitem.title: TAIWAN: ADB to issue Taiwan-dollar bond in Dec - paper.
newsitem.headline: ADB to issue Taiwan-dollar bond in Dec - paper.

text.p: The Asian Development Bank has applied to Taiwan's central bank to issue US$260 million in Taiwan-dollar-denominated bonds in early December, the mass-circulation United Daily News reported on Thursday.
ADB has selected ChinaTrust Commercial Bank as lead underwriter for the 10-year, US$260 million bond issue, the newspaper reported.
Bank officials could not be reached for confirmation due to a national holiday in Taiwan.
ADB originally had scheduled a June launch date for a 10-year, US$200 million issue, but it later postponed the issue without giving a reason.
The December issue would be ADB's second issue denominated in Taiwan dollars.
Taiwan's central bank had said ADB's planned bond issue would help internationalise Taiwan's bond market and raise the credibility of Taiwan's currency.
In August 1995, the ADB issued a seven-year Taiwan dollar-denominated bond valued at T$2.6 billion.
